ch.grengine

Class BaseGrengine

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.grengine.BaseGrengine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Grengine

    public abstract class BaseGrengine
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Abstract base Grengine.

    Implements most convenience methods for using Grengine.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alain Stalder, Made in Switzerland.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Engine engine
      the engine that powers this Grengine.
      protected Loader loader
      the default loader instance, which is implicitly used when no specific loader is indicated.
      protected SourceFactory sourceFactory
      the source factory used to create instances of Source, often implicitly from script text, file or URL.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected BaseGrengine()
      constructor.

      • newAttachedLoader

        public Loader newAttachedLoader()
        creates and gets a new attached loader, backed by the same bytecode as all other shared loaders created by this engine and automatically updated if code layers are set.
        Returns:
        new attached loader
        Since:
        1.0

      • newDetachedLoader

        public Loader newDetachedLoader()
        creates and gets a new detached loader, backed initially by the same bytecode as all attached loaders created by this engine, but not updated if code layers are set.

        For example, a web application might create a detached loader for each new HTTP session: A new loader in order to separate static variables of scripts between sessions (security feature); a detached loader in order to keep code layers constant during the lifetime of the session (consistent behavior of Groovy script calls).

        Returns:
        new detached loader
        Since:
        1.0

      • loadMainClass

        public abstract Class<?> loadMainClass(Loader loader,
                                       Source source)
        loads the main class of the given source from the given loader.

        Note that if a class with the main class name is available for loading, but was not compiled as part of a set of Source that included the given source, that class will not count for loading.

        Parameters:
        loader - loader
        source - source
        Returns:
        main class
        Throws:
        CompileException - if compilation was necessary to load the class and failed
        LoadException - if loading failed, including if the class was not found
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Engine.loadMainClass(Loader loader, Source source)

      • loadMainClass

        public abstract Class<?> loadMainClass(Source source)
        loads the main class of the given source from the default loader.

        Note that if a class with the main class name is available for loading, but was not compiled as part of a set of Source that included the given source, that class will not count for loading.

        Parameters:
        source - source
        Returns:
        main class
        Throws:
        CompileException - if compilation was necessary to load the class and failed
        LoadException - if loading failed, including if the class was not found
        Since:
        1.1.1
        See Also:
        Engine.loadMainClass(Loader loader, Source source)

      • loadClass

        public abstract Class<?> loadClass(Loader loader,
                                   Source source,
                                   String name)
        loads a class with the given name and from the given source from the given loader.

        Note that if a class with the given class name is available for loading, but was not compiled as part of a set of Source that included the given source, that class will not count for loading.

        Parameters:
        loader - loader
        source - source
        name - class name
        Returns:
        class
        Throws:
        CompileException - if compilation was necessary to load the class and failed
        LoadException - if loading failed, including if the class was not found
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Engine.loadClass(Loader loader, Source source, String name)

      • loadClass

        public abstract Class<?> loadClass(Source source,
                                   String name)
        loads a class with the given name and from the given source from the default loader.

        Note that if a class with the given class name is available for loading, but was not compiled as part of a set of Source that included the given source, that class will not count for loading.

        Parameters:
        source - source
        name - class name
        Returns:
        class
        Throws:

        LoadException - if loading failed, including if the class was not found
        Since:
        1.1.1
        See Also:
        Engine.loadClass(Loader loader, Source source, String name)

      • loadClass

        public abstract Class<?> loadClass(Loader loader,
                                   String name)
        loads a class by name from the given loader.

        Note that a top code cache is not searched in this case, because each set of source has its own top loader.

        Parameters:
        loader - loader
        name - class name
        Returns:
        class
        Throws:
        LoadException - if loading failed, including if the class was not found
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Engine.loadClass(Loader loader, String name)

      • loadClass

        public abstract Class<?> loadClass(String name)
        loads a class by name from the default loader.

        Note that a top code cache is not searched in this case, because each set of source has its own top loader.

        Parameters:
        name - class name
        Returns:
        class
        Throws:
        LoadException - if loading failed, including if the class was not found
        Since:
        1.1.1
        See Also:
        Engine.loadClass(Loader loader, String name)

      • close

        public void close()
        release metadata for all classed ever loaded using this engine.

        Allows to remove metadata associated by Groovy (or Java) with a class, which is often necessary to get on-the-fly garbage collection.

        Generally call only when really done using this engine and all loaded classes; subsequently trying to use this engine or its classes results generally in undefined behavior.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Since:
        1.1

      • asClassLoader

        public ClassLoader asClassLoader(Loader loader)
        returns a new class loader based on the engine and the given loader.

        Note that the returned class loader typically does not load classes itself; it just wraps the engine and its loader.

        Parameters:
        loader - loader
        Returns:
        class loader
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the loader is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the loader does not match the engine
        Since:
        1.3

      • asClassLoader

        public ClassLoader asClassLoader()
        returns a new class loader based on the engine and its default attached loader.

        Note that the returned class loader typically does not load classes itself; it just wraps the engine and its loader.

        Returns:
        class loader
        Since:
        1.3

        Returns:
        new instance
        Throws:
        CompileException - if compiling failed
        LoadException - if loading failed
        CreateException - if could not create the instance or is not a script
        Since:
        1.0

        public groovy.lang.Script create(Source source)

        Returns:

        Throws:
        CompileException - if compiling failed

      • binding

        public groovy.lang.Binding binding(String key1,
                                   Object value1,
                                   String key2,
                                   Object value2,
                                   String key3,
                                   Object value3,
                                   String key4,
                                   Object value4,
                                   String key5,
                                   Object value5,
                                   Object... moreKeyValuePairs)
        creates a binding using the given keys and values.
        Parameters:
        key1 - key 1
        value1 - value 1
        key2 - key 2
        value2 - value 2
        key3 - key 3
        value3 - value 3
        key4 - key 4
        value4 - value 4
        key5 - key 5
        value5 - value 5
        moreKeyValuePairs - must be an even number of arguments (key/value) and all keys must be strings
        Returns:
        new binding
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number of arguments is odd or if a key is not a string
        Since:
        1.0

      • run

        public Object run(groovy.lang.Script script)
        runs the given script (empty binding).

        Note that the script may throw anything, checked or unchecked.

        Parameters:
        script - script
        Returns:
        what the script returned
        Since:
        1.0
        Throws (out of Groovy script):
        Throwable - anything (checked or unchecked) that Script.run() may throw
